proposals.reasoning: This follows the broadly supported structure of exactly one of Alice/Bob, one of Frank/Henry, and one quieter player, without leaning into any of the repeatedly pre-packaged trios like 'Alice + Henry + Grace' or 'Bob + Jack + Iris'. Alice represents a single early driver, I’m in the Frank/Henry slot, and Iris is a quieter player who hasn’t been over-bundled, which gives us a balanced first mission for information without rubber-stamping prior suggested bundles.

votes.comment: Reasonable first mission: follows the widely supported pattern (one of Alice/Bob, one of Frank/Henry, one quieter) while avoiding the repeatedly bundled trios, so it’s a balanced info-gathering team with no strong red flags yet.
Reasonable structure for Mission 1 (one driver, one of Frank/Henry, one quieter), avoids the over-packaged trios and gives us early info without obvious red flags.
Matches my stated preference of exactly one of Alice/Bob plus a quieter player and avoids pairing both Alice and Bob; decent info-gathering first team without obvious red flags.
Has one known evil (Henry) on it and fits the broadly agreed structure, so it’s a good setup for us to decide later whether to sabotage or build trust.
Fits the preferred pattern (one of Alice/Bob, one of Frank/Henry, one quieter player) without the over-bundled trios; acceptable info-gathering first team with a Merlin candidate included.

I don’t like how quickly consensus formed around this exact pattern and then landed on Henry + Iris together; I’d rather see a mix that includes one of Alice/Bob plus one of Frank/Grace and a quieter player who hasn’t suddenly become the default plug-in choice.

Fits the widely agreed structure (one of Alice/Bob, one of Frank/Henry, one quieter player), avoids the over-packaged trios I was worried about, and gives us early info without me being tied into a suspicious bundle.
I’m on the team and it fits the broadly supported structure without the overly pre-packaged trios, so it’s a solid first mission lineup to gather info.
I like being on the first team as it guarantees at least one sabotager option and gives useful early info without relying on the pre-packaged trios.
Has one known-to-me evil (Henry) and looks broadly reasonable to others, giving us an early chance to sabotage and gather info without drawing suspicion.

discussion.content: Since it’s the first mission and we’ve got almost no info, I’d lean toward a team of quieter, less pushy players for now—people who aren’t aggressively steering the conversation yet. Maybe something like me plus two folks who haven’t been trying to control the narrative.

I’d rather not just default to whoever volunteers first—early controllers can easily be evil—so I’d like at least one person who’s been more analytical than persuasive. I’m okay going on the first team myself, plus one of Alice/Charlie and one quieter player so we spread the risk a bit.

I’d rather avoid a team made up only of people eager to be on it—so I like including one of Alice/Bob plus at least one quieter player, but I’d prefer not to send both Alice and Bob together on the very first mission.

I like the idea of exactly one of Alice/Bob, plus two quieter folks so we’re not stacking “drivers” on the very first team—something like Alice + Henry + Grace or Bob + Jack + Iris feels like a reasonable spread for now.

I’d also prefer just one of the early “drivers” (Alice or Bob), plus at least one of Frank or Henry and a quieter player, so we’re spreading info without stacking all the influence on a single team. Among Diana’s ideas, something like Alice + Henry + Grace feels like a decent first shot to me.

I’d rather not stack the first team with people who were pre-packaged together in early suggestions like “Alice + Henry + Grace” or “Bob + Jack + Iris”—I’d feel better about something like Alice, Grace, and one of Charlie/Eve instead. That keeps us to one early driver, avoids some of the more convenient pairings, and still gives us a decent info spread.

I’m wary of how often “Alice + Henry + Grace” has been floated already, so I’d rather see a mix like one of Alice/Bob, one of Frank/Henry, and one quieter player who hasn’t been pre-packaged into every early suggestion. If I’m on the team, I’d prefer not to be paired with both Alice and Henry together on this first mission.

I agree we shouldn’t lean into the pre-packaged “Alice + Henry + Grace” trio, but I do like the pattern of exactly one of Alice/Bob plus one of Frank/Henry plus a quieter player like Iris. I’m fine being on that kind of mixed team (say Alice + Henry + Iris), but I care more about avoiding those repeatedly floated bundles than about any specific name.

I like the idea of exactly one of Alice/Bob plus one of Frank/Henry, but I’d prefer we avoid any of the repeatedly packaged trios like Alice + Henry + Grace so we’re not giving an easy cover to an early coordinated pair. If we follow that pattern, something like Bob + Frank + a quieter player (say Jack or me) seems like a reasonable first test.

Given all the talk, I also like the “one of Alice/Bob, one of Frank/Henry, plus a quieter player” structure, but I’d rather avoid the repeatedly floated bundles like Alice + Henry + Grace. Something like Bob + Henry + Grace feels like a cleaner mix that still gives us a decent first read without just rubber‑stamping earlier suggestions.

proposals.reasoning: The table consensus after Mission 1 is to treat Alice as tentatively good while avoiding both Henry and me (Iris) this round, to get a cleaner signal. Multiple players explicitly endorsed a lineup of Alice, Charlie, Diana, and Grace as a solid, mostly-new team that doesn’t repeat the Henry–Iris combo. Proposing this team aligns with the expressed preferences of most players, maximizes the chance of getting the mission approved, and gives the group new information on three players who haven’t been on a mission yet.

votes.comment: Team excludes both main suspects Henry and Iris while including me and three untested players, giving a clean information-gathering mission with no obvious downside for good.
Fits the consensus strategy: keep Henry and Iris off, include tentatively good Alice plus three new players for a cleaner info read.
Fits table consensus: keeps both Henry and Iris off after a 1-fail mission, includes tentatively good Alice plus three untested players for a cleaner info-gathering round.
I’m on the team and it matches the table’s consensus to avoid Henry and Iris while adding mostly new players, so it’s a reasonable lineup to test.
Team avoids the Henry–Iris pair from the failed mission while keeping Alice (tentatively good) and adds three new players for a clean information gain.
Keeps both Henry and Iris off after a 1-fail mission, includes the tentatively trusted Alice plus three fresh players for a clean information-gathering team.
Team excludes main suspects Henry and Iris, includes tentatively trusted Alice plus three untested players (including me), which should give a clean info-gathering mission.
This matches the table’s consensus to avoid the Henry–Iris combo and gives us fresh info on three new players, so it’s a reasonable lineup to move forward with.
Matches table consensus to avoid the Henry–Iris combo and gives new info on three untested players while keeping the tentatively trusted Alice.
Solid chance to get an evil on a widely supported team; we can decide later whether to fail or pass for information and cover.

discussion.content: Given the first mission had exactly one fail, it has to be either Henry or Iris, and I know it’s not me—so for this mission I’d strongly prefer a team that includes me but avoids having both Henry and Iris together, if not excluding them entirely.

I’m inclined to avoid putting both Henry and Iris together again—at minimum we should only take one of them this round, and fill the rest with people who haven’t been on a mission yet. Personally, I’d be comfortable including Alice plus two new faces, and then we can start building a trust base from there.
I’m inclined to treat Alice as likely good for now and avoid both Henry and Iris this round—let’s take Alice plus three people who haven’t been on a mission yet so we get a cleaner signal.

I agree we should treat Alice as tentatively good and avoid putting Henry and Iris together again—I'd like to see a team with Alice plus mostly new people, and I’d be happy to be included so we can start getting more info on the rest of the table.

I’m on board with treating Alice as likely good for now and not repeating the Henry–Iris combo, so I’d like to see a team of Alice plus mostly new people—maybe something like Alice, Charlie, Diana, and one of Frank/Grace.

I like the idea of locking in Alice as tentatively good and completely skipping both Henry and Iris this round; something like Alice, Charlie, Diana, and Grace feels like a solid way to get a cleaner read on the table. I’d approve that kind of lineup.

I’m also fine treating Alice as tentatively good, and I’d strongly prefer a team that excludes both Henry and Iris this round—something like Alice, Charlie, Diana, and me seems like a reasonable way to get fresh info.

I get that I look suspicious after the first mission, so I’m fine being left off this one, but I’d really caution against treating Alice as auto-cleared based on a single round. Something like Alice plus a mix of new people—say two of Charlie/Diana/Grace and one of Bob/Frank/Jack—seems like a reasonable way to spread the info without doubling up on the Henry–Iris combo.

Given how that first mission went, I completely understand people not wanting Henry and me together—or even on this mission at all—so I’m fine sitting out, but I’d also caution against locking Alice in as “definitely good” based on just one data point.

I’m fine treating Henry and Iris as the main suspects for now and leaving both off this mission, but I really don’t like how quickly Alice is getting “auto-cleared” either—something like Alice, Charlie, Diana, and one of Bob/Frank feels like a reasonable compromise to me.

proposals.reasoning: This team stays entirely within the agreed-on 'safe pool' {Alice, Bob, Eve, Frank, Jack} while also avoiding everyone tied to the previous fails ({Henry, Iris, Charlie, Diana, Grace}). Including both Alice and Bob matches the consensus that they should anchor this mission, and adding Eve follows the strong support she’s had as a likely-safe pick. I’m putting myself (Jack) on instead of Frank so we don’t auto-clear Frank without ever testing me; a clean result from this lineup gives us a confirmed-good block to compare against Frank later, while still maximizing our odds of avoiding repeats from the earlier failing teams.

votes.comment: Best available team entirely outside the two failing mission pools; we have no specific suspicion on Bob/Eve/Jack, and we need a clean result and new info now.
Alice is the only player on both failed missions; anchoring a must-win team on her is too risky. I’d prefer a team like Bob, Eve, Frank, Jack that fully avoids all prior fail teams, including Alice.

Given the mission results, there are definitely evils among {Henry, Iris} and {Diana, Grace}, plus additional evils likely in {Bob, Eve, Frank, Jack}. This team takes 3 from {Bob, Eve, Frank, Jack} with Alice, which is very likely to include at least one spy and gives us almost no structural reason to expect a clean result. I want a team that includes me and at least one of the previously implicated groups after more careful selection, not this high-risk block.
Team includes an evil (Jack) while avoiding suspicion-heavy players, and a fail here wins the game for evil.
Given limited hard info and broad consensus on the safe pool, this is a reasonable attempt at a clean mission and useful comparison point with Frank later.

I’d rather stick with the earlier consensus of Alice–Bob–Eve–Frank first; swapping in an untested Jack here feels like adding risk when we’re already down 0–2 and really need the safest possible lineup.

I know I’m good, so the evil from Mission 2 is in {Alice, Charlie, Diana}. Combining that with Mission 1, Alice is in both suspicious sets; I’d rather run Bob, Eve, Frank, Jack and avoid Alice entirely for our must-succeed mission.
Jack is evil and on the team; a fail here wins the game for evil, and I’m not on the mission so my hands stay clean.
Fits the agreed-on safe pool I supported earlier and avoids everyone tied to prior fails, so rejecting it would look inconsistent and suspicious.
I’m on the team and can sabotage, and the composition fits the ‘safe pool’ logic so it should be widely approved.

discussion.content: From the two fails we know there’s exactly one evil in {Henry, Iris} and exactly one in {Charlie, Diana, Grace}, so for this mission I’d strongly prefer a team built from me plus three of {Bob, Eve, Frank, Jack}.

I like Alice’s logic: for this round I’d only pick from {Alice, me, Eve, Frank, Jack} and leave Henry, Iris, Charlie, Diana, and Grace off the team entirely. If we stick to that pool we should finally get a clean mission and some real info.

I’m on board with avoiding {Henry, Iris, Diana, Grace} for this mission, but obviously I know I’m good, so if people are nervous about including me we should at least stick to Alice’s suggested pool of Alice + three from {Bob, Eve, Frank, Jack}.

Sticking to Alice’s pool makes sense to me here—something like Alice, Bob, Eve, and either Frank or Jack feels like the cleanest way to minimize risk and actually get us a clear read. I’m fine sitting this one out given the suspicions around the last team.

I’m good with the “safe pool” idea of {Alice, Bob, me, Frank, Jack}, and I’d really like to see a team of Alice, Bob, Frank, and either me or Jack this round. Given two fails already, keeping Henry, Iris, Charlie, Diana, and Grace off this one feels like our best shot at a clean result.
I like the narrowed “safe pool,” but given how badly we need a clean result, I’d lean toward Alice, Bob, Eve, and me this round and leave Jack off just to keep things as controlled as possible.

I get why people want to sideline me after the last mission, but remember that if you hard-lock the “safe pool” and it’s actually hiding 1–2 evils, we’re walking straight into a loss; I’d slightly prefer at least one of {Charlie, Diana, me} rotated in later for comparison, but for this mission I’ll reluctantly go along with something like Alice, Bob, Eve, Frank.

Given the info from the first two missions, I agree we should hard-avoid {Henry, Iris, Diana, Grace} this round, and I’d like to see a team of Alice, Bob, Eve, and Jack so we’re not auto-clearing Frank without ever testing Jack.

Given how the first two missions went, I’m fine being left off and sticking to the “safe pool” for now—something like Alice, Bob, Eve, and either Frank or Jack seems reasonable, as long as we start getting some clearer info from the results.

I’m on board with the “safe pool,” but I’d slightly prefer Alice, Bob, Eve, and me this round so we’re not just auto-clearing Frank without ever putting me on a mission. If that team comes back clean, we get both a good result and a real comparison point with Frank for later.
